    • startDateLimit

      public static java.time.LocalDate startDateLimit
      The earliest available date obtained from iterating over every record from the dataset. This date limit is used to initialize datePicker, to restrict the selectable dates to a reasonable range.

    • endLDateLimit

      public static java.time.LocalDate endLDateLimit
      Today's date. This date limit is used to initialize datePicker, to restrict the selectable dates to a reasonable range.

    • getCountryNames

      public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getCountryNames()
      Returns all country names from the dataset, stored inside a Set, where duplication is disallowed. Every country that appeared in the dataset will appear here exactly once.
      Returns:
      A Set of country names. This set allows no duplication.

    • getCountryNamesWithDuplication

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCountryNamesWithDuplication()
      Returns all country names from the dataset, stored inside a List, where duplication is allowed. This is also the column with header "location", stored inside a List.
      Returns:
      A List of country names. This list allows duplication.

    • getStartEndIndexesByCountry

      public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer>> getStartEndIndexesByCountry()
      Returns a Map which has every country from the dataset as the key, whose value is another Map, which stores the start and end indexes of a country within the dataset. 
       e.g. 
 To get the start index of Afghanistan within the dataset,
 we can use getStartendIndexesByCountry().get("Afghanistan").get("start").
 This will return 0, since the very first record of Afghanistan is the 0-th record.
 
 To get the end index of Afghanistan within the dataset,
 we can use getStartendIndexesByCountry().get("Afghanistan").get("end").
 This will return 512, which is the position of the last occurrence of Afghanistan
 within the dataset.
      Returns:
      A Map which maps each country name to another Map, whose only possible key values are "start" and "end", each of which maps to the start and end indexes in the dataset respectively.

    • initializeCountryNames

      public static void initializeCountryNames()
      This method initializes variables in this class, such as: countryNames, countryNamesWithDuplication, startEndIndexesByCountry, startDateLimit by examining each record from the dataset

    • getExcelData

      public static java.util.List<org.apache.commons.csv.CSVRecord> getExcelData()
      Returns a List containing all records from the imported csv.
      Returns:
      Returns a List containing all records from the imported csv.

    • initializeExcelData

      public static void initializeExcelData​(java.lang.String dataset)
      This initializes the variable ExcelData.
      Parameters:
      dataset - the filename of the dataset.
